page.title: 08A Beef Farm near Combwich
page.content: Just off the road from Cannington to Combwich,{Mr. Baker }has a farm. He raises beef cattle.There are 3 types Red Devons,Herefords and Simmentel. The farm is 133 acres in size and at the moment there are 70 cattle. There are no other animals on the farm and no other farm workers. The cattle are bought as young bullocks,grazed and fed until maturity and then sold at market to be slaughtered for meat.Most of the land is used for grazing,but some hay is made. Mr Baker has 3 tractors, a bailer,a ditch digger and a building to house the cattle in winter. Mr. Baker lives in a modern bungalow but there is a very old farm house in which machinery like a corn crusher is kept.
